plants.name: Rosa chinensis
plants.description: A species of rose native to Southwest China, known for its continuous blooming habit throughout the warm months. It bears fragrant, single or semi-double flowers that range in color from pink to red.
plants.location: Native to China, widely cultivated globally in temperate and subtropical gardens
plants.funFact: The China Rose was instrumental in breeding many modern hybrid tea roses because of its recurrent blooming.

plants.name: Lupinus perennis
plants.description: A perennial wildflower native to eastern North America, characterized by tall spikes densely packed with pea-shaped, blue-purple flowers. It often blooms in open sandy soils and pine barrens.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late Spring to Early Summer (May - June)
plants.funFact: Wild Lupine is the sole larval host for the endangered Karner blue butterfly, highlighting its ecological importance.

plants.name: Delphinium elatum
plants.description: A tall herbaceous perennial with showy racemes of deeply lobed blue, purple, or white flowers. Commonly grown in northern hemisphere gardens as a striking summer ornamental.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late Spring to Early Summer (May - June)
plants.location: Native to Europe and Asia, cultivated widely in temperate gardens
plants.funFact: The genus name Delphinium comes from the Greek word for dolphin, as the flower buds are said to resemble dolphins.

plants.name: Grevillea robusta
plants.description: An evergreen tree native to eastern Australia, producing showy clusters of bright orange to golden-yellow spider-like flowers, attracting birds and insects.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late Spring to Early Summer (October - December in Southern Hemisphere)
plants.location: Eastern Australia (blooming in Southern Hemisphere spring), cultivated in subtropical regions worldwide
plants.funFact: Silky Oak wood is valued for its strength and rich color, often used in furniture making and veneer.
